Scholars, may Allah have mercy on them (1), mentioned narrations from the Predecessors warning against sitting with people of desires due to its danger to hearts. Among that: "Abu Qilaba, may Allah have mercy on him, said: Do not sit with people of desires - or he said: people of disputes - for I do not feel safe that they might immerse you in their misguidance and confuse you about some of what you know. Two men from the people of desires entered upon Muhammad bin Sirin and said: O Abu Bakr, shall we narrate a hadith to you? He said: No. They said: Shall we read a verse to you? He said: No, either you leave me or I leave. So they left. Some people said: O Abu Bakr, what harm is there if a verse is read to you?! ... He said: I feared that they might read a verse and distort it, and that would settle in my heart. A man from the people of innovation said to Ayyub: O Abu Bakr, I ask you about a word? He turned away, signaling with his hand: No, not even half a word. Al-Hasan used to say: The worst disease that enters a heart - meaning: desires. Hudhayfah said: Fear Allah, and take the path of those who were before you. By Allah, if you remain steadfast, you have outstripped by a far distance. But if you leave it right and left, you have gone astray into a far error - or he said: clear -" (2).
A man said to Ibn Sirin: "Indeed So-and-so wants to come to you and will not speak anything. He said: Tell So-and-so: No, let him not come to me. For the heart of the son of Adam is weak, and I fear to hear a word from him and my heart might not return to what it was" (3).
Al-Ajurri narrates with his chain from Mahdi bin Maymun who said: "I heard Muhammad - meaning Ibn Sirin - and a man argued with him (4) about something. Muhammad said: I know what you want, and I am more knowledgeable about arguing than you, but I will not argue with you" (5).
Look at this great Imam, one of the seniors of Ahlus-Sunnah in knowledge and action. Despite this...

...great knowledge and ability to debate, he feared for his heart that a doubt might penetrate it and it would not return to how it was, and its tenderness, humility, and pleasure in worship would go away due to hearing the speech of people of falsehood. It sickens hearts even if they were healthy, and corrupts them even if they were sound. So beware, beware. Hearing or seeing people of falsehood is considered a punishment for people of living hearts. The mother of Jurayj the monk prayed against her son - when he preferred voluntary prayer over answering her - that Allah punish him by seeing the faces of sinful women, meaning prostitutes. Allah punished him with that because seeing dark faces transmits its effect to the heart with some blurriness in seeing the truth. Whoever lets his gaze wander in those faces and listens to their speech, a darkness strikes his heart according to the proximity, the effect of which reflects in his aversion to the Quran and its people. It also affects the purity of the heart, so turbidity strikes it which weakens its understanding of the Quran, incapacitates reflection upon it, and the chest tightens at its recitation. He finds no pleasure in reflecting upon it and understanding it, nor benefits from its admonitions, deterrents, promises, and threats. His heart's condition might reach the point where he finds pleasure in forbidden desires like listening to musical instruments that he does not find when reciting or listening to the Quran. We ask Allah for well-being and safety.

**Requirement 9: Sins committed in seclusion.**
Sins have a great effect on blinding the heart so it does not see the realities of the Quran nor perceives its light. Allah says: {For indeed, it is not eyes that are blinded, but blinded are the hearts which are within the breasts} [Al-Hajj: 46]. Due to sins, a covering comes over the heart called Al-Ran, which the verse mentioned, and as in the hadith of Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, who said: "When a servant commits a sin, a black dot is marked in his heart. If he gives up, seeks forgiveness, and repents, his heart is polished. But if he returns, it is increased until it covers his heart. That is the Ran which Allah mentioned: {No! Rather, the stain has covered their hearts of that which they were earning} [Al-Mutaffifin: 14]."
Among the most dangerous sins to the heart are sins of seclusion. They corrupt the heart and destroy righteous deeds on the Day of Resurrection, until their doer becomes one of the bankrupt. Here is this great hadith that clarifies the danger of sins in the state of seclusion with Allah and lack of shame. He, peace be upon him, said: "I certainly know people of my Ummah who will come on the Day of Resurrection with good deeds like the mountains of Tihamah white (bright), and Allah Almighty will make them scattered dust." Thawban said: "O Messenger of Allah, describe them to us, make them clear to us, so that we may not be...

...of them while we do not know." He said: "They are your brothers and from your race, and they take from the night as you take, but they are a people who, when they are alone with the prohibitions of Allah, violate them" (1).
Based on this, hearts afflicted with such a disease do not benefit from the Quran and are far from being affected by it. A barrier has been placed between them and reflecting upon it and benefiting from it. They are hard hearts; heedlessness has struck their corners, and Satan has rallied against them with his cavalry and infantry. They violated prohibitions when alone and were heedless of Allah's knowledge of them, His hearing, and His seeing of them. So they unleashed themselves into forbidden desires. This is an example of that: when one of them is alone with the screen of his device, he looks when no human observer sees him; he looks at what Allah has forbidden of what his mobile device, computer, or satellite channel displays. He gives pleasure to his eyes and listens with his ears to the forbidden. If a human were watching him, he would not do that out of fear and shyness of them. We ask Allah for well-being and safety.

**Requirement 10: Attachment to forbidden desires of the self, such as listening to forbidden things, looking at them, and consuming forbidden things.**
Sins have been discussed repeatedly, but here I intend a type of sin that has a great impact on its doer's aversion to the Quran, lack of benefit from it, and inability to reflect upon it as Allah loves and is pleased with. Among them:
1. Listening to musical instruments.
2. Looking with desire at what Allah has forbidden of women and beardless boys (2).
3. Eating and drinking the forbidden.

And peace and blessings be upon our Prophet, Imam, and Role Model, Muhammad, the Servant of Allah and His Messenger.
